description: Get your hands on this mouth-watering, cheese-stuffed beef burger with the lot. With the addition of bacon, lettuce and tomato, it's perfect for summer feasting.
keywords: Beef burger,Fakeaway,Quick & easy dinner,Mince,Quick & easy lunch,Tomato,Jan Feb 2021,Beef
name: Cheese-Stuffed Beef Burgers Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 4 tbs tomato sauce (save 2 tbs to serve)
0.25 iceberg lettuce, leaves separated, roughly torn

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 220°C/200°C fan-forced. Line a baking tray with baking paper.

Place mince, onion, sauce, garlic powder and egg in a bowl. Season, then mix well to combine. Shape mixture into 4 patties. Fold 4 cheese slices into eighths, then carefully press into centres of patties, moulding mince to enclose cheese. Chill patties in fridge for 15 minutes or until firm.
Meanwhile, place bacon on tray. Brush both sides with syrup, then bake for 15 minutes, turning once halfway, or until golden and crisp.
Meanwhile, heat oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Cook patties for 5 minutes on each side, topping each with remaining cheese in the last 2 minutes of cooking, or until cooked through.
Spread bun bases with extra sauce, then top with lettuce, tomato, bacon and patties. Sandwich with roll tops and serve.
